alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 15 at 3:22PM EDT until July 15 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Somerset County in northern New Jersey... Central Middlesex County in northern New Jersey... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 322 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Kendall Park, or near New Brunswick, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... New Brunswick, Somerset, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, North Brunswick, Middlesex, Rocky Hill, Millstone, Kingston, Dayton, Kendall Park, Society Hill, North Brunswick Township, Belle Mead, South River, Highland Park, Dunellen, Milltown, South Bound Brook and Monmouth Junction. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 10. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 5 and 11. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
